overview_of_class: This course will provide an overview of neural processes underlying emotional and social processes. The course will include discussion of contemporary theories of social-emotional processes, 21st century methods for examining the social-emotional brain (e.g., MRI, PET, ERP, EEG), the circuits in the brain underlying the experience of emotion, biological mechanisms underlying social-emotional disorders (depression, anxiety, autism), neuroplasticity, and future directions in the study of the social-emotional brain. The course is introductory in nature and it is not expected that students have previous courses in either neuroscience or affective science.
